title: Pakistan escapes FATF blacklist due to Imran’s leadership: Advisor
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 25 (APP): Advisor to Prime Minister on Interior and Accountability Barrister Mirza Shahzad Akbar on Friday said Pakistan has escaped (FATF) Financial Action Task Force’s blacklisting due to the leadership and government of Prime Minister Imran Khan.
پاکستان کا فیٹیف کی گرے لسٹ میں جانے کی ایک بڑی وجہ یہ بھی تھی کہ فرسٹ فیملی یعنی وزیراعظم اور وزیراعلی دونوں منی لانڈرنگ میں خود ملوث تھےشکر ہے اب عمران خان کی حکومت ہے اور منی لانڈر یا مفرور ہیں یا جیلوں میں اور ملک بلیک لسٹنگ سے بچ گیا ہے https://t.co/bV5C1UNxBS
— Mirza Shahzad Akbar (@ShazadAkbar) June 25, 2021
Responding to a tweet of (PML-N ) Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz Information Secretary Mariyam Aurangzeb, the advisor said right now the money launderers are either fugitives or are in jail.
The main reason of country’s inclusion in the grey list was the involvement of former first family especially former Prime Minister and the Chief Minister in the money laundering.
